Description: Part of cylindrical stem and floor (mended from two fragments) of East Greek grey ware pottery open vessel, possibly a krater or stemmed bowl; lower part of stem lost; floor slightly curving; dark grey slip on exterior; decoration in relief at join of body and stem, consisting of one incised braided band and one simple band.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.077)
